summary: Agent integration architecture doc recommends Claude Code + Twining as primary path, blackboard over orchestrator
context: User asked for research on which agent frameworks work best with Twining. A previous session generated an inaccurate multi-repo orchestrator design that proposed the anti-pattern the user rejected. Needed a grounded, opinionated analysis verified against actual codebase.
rationale: Claude Code + Twining MCP scores 15/15 because Claude Code is both MCP host and SWE agent natively, Twining provides persistent shared state through standard MCP tools, and subagents inherit connections automatically. Blackboard coordination fits MCP's request/response model (no push channel for orchestrator assignment), survives context resets (decisions persist in files), and enables token-budgeted selective injection. Academic research (LbMAS 2025) validates blackboard outperforming orchestrator patterns for LLM agents.

alternatives.option: Recommend Strands Agents (AWS) as primary host
cons: Shared memory is in-process not persistent
Requires AWS Bedrock for full value
alternatives.reason_rejected: Claude Code already provides the SWE agent loop, MCP hosting, and subagent management — adding Strands would add a layer without clear benefit for the SWE use case

alternatives.option: Recommend orchestrator framework (CrewAI/LangGraph) with Twining bolted on
cons: Orchestrator model conflicts with blackboard self-selection
Requires adapters to use Twining as shared state
alternatives.reason_rejected: Orchestrator coordination model is fundamentally incompatible with blackboard pattern — the user identified this as the key insight
